src:
Harapan Menpora untuk Timnas Renang di SEA Games 2019
05 Nov 2019, 20:27 by Anggi Tiar


Harapan Menpora untuk Timnas Renang di SEA Games 2019

KBRN, Jakarta: bisa bikinMenteri Pemuda dan Olahraga (Menpora) RI,  Zainudin Amali mengunjungi pelatnas akuatik yang dipimpin Ketua Umum PB PRSI, Anindya Novyan Bakrie di Stadion Akuatik Gelora Bung Karno Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Menpora juga didampingi Harry Warganegara (CdM Indonesia di SEA Games 2019). Zainudin sendiri puas dengan persiapan yang dilakukan oleh pelatnas timnas renang Indonesia. 
Lebih lanjut dia berharap dalam SEA Games 2019 di Manila, Filipina nanti empat emas setidaknya bisa direalisasikan. 
"Fasilitas untuk renang dan olahraga air kita cukup mewah. Karena itu standar internasional, pemerintah punya harapan besar terhadap akuatik kita untuk Sea Games,” ungkap Zainudin Amali kepada wartawan usai kunjungannya. 
“Oleh CdM dari sini (Timnas Renang) kita dapatkan enam kalau ketua umum empat. Saya gak tau seperti apa CdM tambahkan dua itu, " tambah Zainudin. 
Sebagai informasi, pada SEA Games 2019 Filipina, Tim Akuatik Indonesia akan mengikuti empat nomor yakni renang, polo air, loncat indah dan renang perairan terbuka.
text:
Menpora hopes for the national swimming team at the 2019 SEA Games
05 Nov 2019, 20:27 by Anggi Tiar


Menpora hopes for the national swimming team at the 2019 SEA Games

KBRN, Jakarta: can make the Minister of Youth and Sports (Menpora) of Indonesia, Zainudin Amali visit the aquatic national training chaired by PB PRSI Chairman, Anindya Novyan Bakrie at the Bung Karno Aquatic Stadium in Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5/2019).
The Menpora was also accompanied by Harry Citizen (CdM Indonesia at the 2019 SEA Games). Zainudin himself was satisfied with the preparations made by the Indonesian swimming national team.
He further hopes that in the 2019 SEA Games in Manila, the Philippines, at least four gold can be realized.
"Our facilities for swimming and water sports are quite luxurious. Because of that international standard, the government has high hopes for our aquatics for the Sea Games," Zainudin Amali told reporters after his visit.
"By CdM from here (the Swimming National Team) we get six if the general chair is four. I don't know what CdM adds to the two, "Zainudin added.
For information, at the 2019 SEA Games in the Philippines, the Indonesian Aquatic Team will follow four numbers namely swimming, water polo, beautiful jumping and open water swimming.
